UnitInfo.Strategy: Foxfire, the Faerie Hero, is a magical beast with the cunning of a fox, and will split into more foxes when defeated.

UnitInfo.Civilopedia: Wildfae are too fickle to swear allegiance to either Winter or Summer. Yet, at the same time, this precise reason makes them acceptable in both.

UnitInfo.Strategy: Sprites are the inhabitants of the Summer Court. They fill the Court with their brimming light and laughters.

Pixies tend the Winter Court's ice garden with unmatched zeal, both in decorating it with ice statues and in guarding it against enemies. Often, Pixies do the decorating and eliminating enemies at the same time.
Sun Faeries hold the control over Summer Court until the Fae Lords are back.
The Winter Court's hidden blade, the Moon Faeries kill without mercy those who dare to enter their domain.

UnitInfo.Civilopedia: Fetches steal the abilities of the units they defeat.

UnitInfo.Strategy: The nobility of the Summer Court
The nobility of the Winter Court
The ultimate Faerie, the Fae lords are the nobility of the Eternal Court, and have the powers of all Faeries.

UnitInfo.Civilopedia: Larincsidhe restored to his original power that he had back in the Age of Magic.

UnitInfo.Strategy: The Erlking is summoned by the Faerie World Spell, which unleashes the Wild Hunt. Every unit that fights the Erlking joins the hunt as a Wild Hunter.

UnitInfo.Civilopedia: Huntsman can be summoned by the Erlking, when he calls the Wild Hunt.
